title: Narra
description: The National Tree of the Philippines, commonly found in Bukidnon plantation areas and farmlands.
medicinal: Bark decoction used for skin infections.

title: Molave
description: A durable hardwood tree abundant in Malaybalay and Valencia’s dry upland areas.
medicinal: Leaves boiled for fever and headaches.

title: Red Lauan
description: A dipterocarp species found in the Mt. Kitanglad Range Natural Park.
medicinal: Resin traditionally used to seal wounds.

title: White Lauan
description: Common in Bukidnon’s high-elevation forests such as Mt. Kitanglad and Mt. Kalatungan.

title: Yakal
description: A slow-growing hardwood tree occasionally found in Bukidnon’s southern forests.

title: Mangkono (Philippine Ironwood)
description: Rare in Bukidnon but can be found in protected mountain areas.

title: Kamagong
description: A Philippine ebony tree growing in patches of secondary forests in Malaybalay.

title: Banaba
description: A medicinal tree along rivers and roadsides in Valencia and Quezon.
medicinal: Leaves used for diabetes, kidney cleansing.

title: Lagundi
description: Common in farm edges across Bukidnon.
medicinal: Used for cough, asthma, and colds.

title: Mindanao Cinnamon
description: An endemic cinnamon species found in Lantapan and Kitanglad forests.
medicinal: Bark used for stomachache and flu.

title: Mindanao Rainbow Gum
description: The colorful rainbow eucalyptus growing in Bukidnon plantations and moist areas.

title: Balete
description: Large fig tree found throughout Bukidnon lowlands and communities.
medicinal: Sap and leaves used for fungal infections.
